articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel pounded Rafah with airstrikes and tank fire on Tuesday, pressing its offensive in Gaza's southern city despite international condemnation of an attack that sparked a blaze in a tent camp for the displaced, killing at least 45 people.
articles.title: Israeli forces press Rafah offensive despite global outcry

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain, Ireland and Norway officially recognised a Palestinian state on Tuesday, despite an angry reaction from Israel, which has found itself increasingly isolated after more than seven months of conflict in Gaza.
articles.title: Spain, Ireland and Norway recognise Palestinian statehood

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin warned the West on Tuesday that NATO members in Europe were playing with fire by proposing to let Ukraine use Western weapons to strike inside Russia, which he said could trigger a global conflict.
articles.title: Putin warns West not to let Ukraine use its missiles to hit Russia

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Georgia's parliament voted on Tuesday to override a presidential veto of a bill on "foreign agents" that has plunged the South Caucasus country into crisis, ignoring criticism from the West which says the legislation is authoritarian and Russian-inspired.
articles.title: Georgian parliament votes to override presidential veto of 'foreign agent' bill

articles.author: James Pomfret, Jessie Pang
articles.description: Hong Kong's national security police arrested six people across the city on Tuesday under a new national security law known as Article 23 for alleged seditious intent, according to a statement.
articles.title: Hong Kong arrests six for sedition under new security law

articles.author: Olena Harmash, Sergiy Karazy
articles.description: Ukraine will receive its first supplies of F-16 fighter jets "very soon", but around half of its desperately needed foreign military aid is arriving late, Kyiv's defence minister has said.
articles.title: Ukraine to receive F-16s 'very soon' but much aid arriving late, defence minister says

articles.author: Lewis Jackson, Renju Jose
articles.description: Thousands of residents were ordered to evacuate from the path of a still-active landslide in Papua New Guinea by the government on Tuesday, after parts of a mountain collapsed, burying an initial estimate of more than 2,000 people.
articles.title: Papua New Guinea orders thousands to evacuate from path of 'active' landslide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The body of a five-month-old baby was found on Tuesday when some 85 migrants heading for Italy from Tunisia were rescued from distress at sea, according to a Reuters witness.
articles.title: Baby found dead in stricken migrant boat heading for Italy

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: Pope Francis, widely quoted as having used a highly derogatory word to describe the LGBT community, did not intend to use homophobic language and apologises to anyone offended by it, the Vatican said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Pope issues rare apology over reported homophobic slur

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Alexander Winning
articles.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, who has staked his reputation on cleaning up the image of the ruling African National Congress, will lead the party toward its biggest test of the democratic era when South Africans vote on Wednesday.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa steers ANC into potentially pivotal election
